titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Karl Baarslag papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Paige Minister

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-11-11T14:32-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Complete description of materials added to finding aid by Paige Minister. Collection shrunk from 10 to 7 boxes.

did.unittitle: Karl Baarslag papers
did.abstract: Writings, reports, memoranda, letters, pamphlets, and other printed matter relating to international communism, communism in the United States, communism in maritime unions, and internal security activities of the Office of Naval Intelligence during World War II.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Karl Baarslag papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1985.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collections
relatedmaterial.p: The Church League of America Collection of the Research Files of Counterattack, the Wackenhut Corporation, and Karl Baarslag, Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

Published Robbery by Mail: The Story of the U.S. Postal Inspectors
Lieutenant commander, United States Navy; assigned to Office of Naval Intelligence

Head of the National Americanism Commission of the American Legion
Research director for the Senate Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations
Consultant for the House Committee on Un-American Activities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Karl Baarslag papers contain writings, reports, memoranda, letters, pamphlets, books, and other printed matter relating to international communism, communism in the United States, communism in maritime unions, and internal security activities of the Office of Naval Intelligence during World War II. Some of Baarslag's own writings on communism; chapters from his unpublished memoir, "Backwards, Turn Backwards;" and his writings on other research interests are also included in the papers.

The majority of the material is located in the Communist Activities File, which contains material documenting various domestic and international communist movements and organizations, such as the Communist Party of the United States of America, the International of Seamen and Harbour Workers (ISH), and the Marine Transport Workers of the Western Hemisphere. Of particular note are letters written between 1924 and 1949 by prominent members of the Communist Party USA, including Jay Lovestone and Alex Bail, located in the Communist Party of the United States of America file.
In addition, the collection contains several pamphlets and books relating to communism and socialism, located in the Printed Matter series.

did.unittitle: Biographical File,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of a U.S. News & World Report article about Baarslag's role in the American Legion and a letter introducing Baarslag to Joseph Ku, Political Adviser to the Chinese Embassy in Washington, D.C.

did.unittitle: "Legion's 'Red Chase': Being Toned Down?," U.S. News & World Report,
Letter from Alfred Kohlberg to Joseph Ku re Karl Baarslag,
Correspondence,
Launter, John,
Packard, W. H.,
Writings,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles and drafts of books written by Baarslag. Also included are chapters from Baarslag's unpublished memoir, "Backwards, Turn Backwards." Arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.p: Contains reports, memoranda, news clippings, collected correspondence, writings, and other material related to communism, communist groups, and communist activities in the U.S. and abroad.

Clippings,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes some clippings from the German publication Wir erobern die Betriebe, later known as Die Rote Fahne.

did.unittitle: "Communist Fronts, Their History and Purpose,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Draft of a chapter later published in A Manual for Survival: A Counter-Subversive Study Course, produced by the Church League of America. Possibly written by Karl Baarslag.

did.unittitle: Communist Party of the United States of America file,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes chronological files consisting primarily of collected correspondence of Party members, such as Jay Lovestone, Alex Bail, Bill Dunne, Max Bedacht, and Jack Stachel. Following the chronological files are documents, such as histories of the organization, bulletins, lists, and reports that are arranged alphabetically by document title or topic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains memoranda, drafts of memoranda, and reports written or received by Baarslag regarding Naval internal security, communist groups, and communist activities during World War II.

did.unittitle: "Review of World-Wide Communist Trends,"
Shipmates' Voice,
Simas Kudirka incident,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains press releases, a report, and the published hearings related to the investigation of the events surrounding the attempted defection of a Lithuanian seaman, Simas Kudirka. Kudrika attempted to defect to the U.S. by jumping aboard the USCGC Vigilant while his mother ship was anchored near Martha's Vineyard in Massachusetts.

did.unittitle: "Statement of Lt. Duane Thorin, U.S.N., Ret., Prepared for Delivery to Senate Special Preparedness Subcommittee,"

Miscellany,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of the Waldorf Pledge, a section from V. I. Lenin Collected Works, and mailings from various labor groups.

did.unittitle: Printed Matter,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains pamphlets, books, periodicals, and a report related to communism and socialism in the U.S. and abroad. Includes both communist and anti-communist writings.
